required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Factors Influencing the Composition of Human Milk
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Various Maternal, Infant and Environmental Factors on Human Milk Composition Among Lithuanian Women

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims for characterization of different maternal, infant and environmental factors (e.g. maternal age, pregnancy duration, lactation period, baby gender, circadian rhythm, Holder pasteurisation, etc.) that influence human milk composition.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study consists of three parts. In the first part the investigators aim to evaluate human milk macronutrient composition depending on the time after delivery and pregnancy duration.
In the second part the investigators aim to evaluate the circadian variation of human milk macronutrient and energy content depending on pregnancy duration.
In the third part the investigators aim to evaluate the influence of Holder pasteurisation on human milk macronutrient, metabolome and bioactive protein (lysozyme and lactoferrin) content.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantification of total protein concentration in human milk
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the 2nd week, up to 2 months after delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of total lipids and carbohydrate in human milk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the 2nd week, up to 2 months after delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of lactoferrin in human milk
Quantification of lysozyme in human milk

arm_group.arm_group_label: Mothers of moderate and late preterm infants

intervention.intervention_name: Analysis of human milk composition by mid-infrared spectrophotometry
intervention.description: Analysis of human milk macronutrient content was performed by mid-infrared spectrophotometry using a Miris Human Milk Analyser. An immune-enzymatic ELISA assays were used to estimate lysozyme and lactoferrin concentrations in human milk.
intervention.arm_group_label: Mothers of moderate and late preterm infants

study_pop.textblock: Mothers of newborns admitted at Neonatal Center of Vilnius University Hospital Santaros Klinikos, Lithuania

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
having obtained informed consent; after a single-birth pregnancy; women who were not on a special diet; lactating mothers who could not breastfeed their newborns due to the baby's medical condition (either prematurity or disease) but who expressed milk.
-
Exclusion Criteria:
breastfeeding mothers; history of maternal diabetes, hepatitis B or C, HIV, tuberculosis, mastitis, or oncological disease; drug addicted.
-

facility.name: Neonatal centre of Vilnius University Hospital Santaros Klinikos
